column4: Hey guys....Low Graphics Mode error aftr I updated ubuntu yesterday. Tried all the possible solutiuons posted by forum members but no result. Now I'm geting this screen. Please help http://img97.imageshack.us/img97/671/image0015j.jpg
just exiting to the console and doing a 'sudo service gdm restart' dosent help eh?
what do you have to lose? that will restart the X server. and works for my 2 machines when they have the same issue...
Guys "sudo service gdm restart" says "restart: unknown instance" and sudo "displayconfig-gtk" says "command not found"
perhaps 'sudo service gdm start'
sudo service gdm start says "gdm start/running process 1168"
sudo service gdm start says "gdm start/running process 1168"
so did X startup?  check alt-ctrl-f7 perhaps.
No
you could also just try a 'startx' command and look for errors.
See the screenshot of the problem I posted
I used startx yesterday and it started initializing kde, and then nothing came, blank screen
Also I dont have any idea how did it started initializing KDE?? I don't have KDE installed
try moving your /etc/X11/xorg.conf to /etc/X11/xorg.conf.BACKUP and reboot and se eif it helps.
check to se eif its there.. and CASE IS IMPRONTANT
its X11 not x11
Ohh
Thanks
yep.. linux Basics...
theproblem with just trying commands  is that that can sometimes break things worse.
The suggestion posted by forum members after I posted the solution
just try one and see? not too hard. :)
Well..he said "Failed to mount windows shares" so I thought it might be a problem with firewall. But as I dunno what you suggested him I didn't answer
